>
[Soulspeaker](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1736)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Crown of the Kobold King</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Crown of the Kobold King](/Sources.aspx?ID=148) pg. 117

**Price** 25 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** worn

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This grotesque, amulet-like shrunken head is said to hold a shard of its owner's psyche. The head is often that of a [humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=91), but any creature capable of speaking in life can provide the grisly component needed for this magic item's creation. The head can contain a short message whispered to it and can then be commanded to repeat the message later. While a _soulspeaker_ carries a message, the eyes of the shrunken head open, and they close as soon as its message is delivered.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> command;     **Effect** You cast [_message_](/Spells.aspx?ID=190), but instead of your message being transferred directly to a target's ears, the message is stored in the _soulspeaker_. The _soulspeaker's_ eyes open, and the next time it's activated, the _soulspeaker_ repeats the message you spoke to it with a rasping whisper before its eyes close again, the message expended.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
